text: Construction of <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 Reporter Gene <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Plasmids

The PCR primers DW5'LUC , containing a Kpn I restriction site , and DW3'LUC , containing an Xho I restriction site , were used to PCR amplify and clone the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter ( -3261 to +92 ) from pDB9406 into the Kpn I / Xho I polylinker restriction sites of pGL3 Basic ( Promega ) to produce pGLmP-3261 .
The EcoR I insert of pDB9402-42 was sub-cloned immediately upstream of the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter EcoR I site ( -3261 ) of pGLmP-3261 to produce pGLmP-4480 .

Additional murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 luciferase reporter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constructs ( pGLmP-2751 , pGLmP-2614 , pGLmP-1686 , pGLmP-1341 , pGLmP-694 , pGLmP-539 and pGLmP-189 ) were generated by digesting pGLmP-3261 with <extra_id_0> EcoR I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and a second restriction enzyme ( <extra_id_0> Sfi I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Apa I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> BstX I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Bsu36 I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Pac I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Hae III <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Apo I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> respectively ) , blunt ending the resultant 5 ' or 3 ' overhangs with <extra_id_0> T4 DNA polymerase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( NEB ) and re-ligating the vector ends with <extra_id_0> T4 DNA ligase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The PCR primers BSPCR2 and DW3'LUC were used to subclone the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter regions -87 to +92 into the Kpn I / Xho I polylinker restriction sites of pGL3 Basic to produce pGLmP-87 .
The control empty vector was pGL3 Basic ( Promega ) .

<extra_id_0> Luciferase reporter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constructs containing mutations in the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter LPS - responsive regions E box , PU.1 , Oct-1 and C / EBP ( pGLmP-539mEbox , pGLmP-539mPU.1 , pGLmP-539mOct and pGLmP-539mC / EBP respectively ) were generated as described [ 36 ] .
The mutant oligonucleotide PCR primer sequences are provided in Fig .

S1 , and were used as follows : pGLmP-539mEbox : mPAI2mEboxa and mPAI2mEboxb ; pGLmP-539mPU.1 : mPAI2mPU.1a and mPAI2mPU.1b ; pGLmP-539mOct : mPAI2mOct-2a and mPAI2mOct-2b ; pGLmP-539mC / EBP : mPAI2mCEBPa and mPAI2mCEBPb .
The oligonucleotide PCR primers used to generate mutants , pGLmP-539mCRE , pGLmP-539mAP-1a , and pGLmP-539mAP-1b were reported previously [ 37 ] .
The flanking oligonucleotide PCR primers were RVprimer3 ( Promega ) and GLprimer2 ( Promega ) .
pGLmP-539 was used as the template in each case .

Recombinant PCR products were digested with <extra_id_0> EcoR I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Xho I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and cloned between the EcoR I and Xho I restriction sites of pGLmP-539 in place of the -539 / +92 region of the wild-type murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
Sequence verified constructs were used in the experiments .
